Newfoundland noun
(PLACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an island off the east coast of Canada that is part of the Canadian province (= one of the areas that a country is divided into as part of the organization of its government) of Newfoundland and Labrador: In Newfoundland, they helped the fishermen drag nets onto the shore. Until not that long ago, Newfoundland was comparatively inaccessible to tourists.

Newfoundland noun
(DOG)
[ C ] a type of large, strong dog from Canada that has thick fur and is known for being a very good swimmer: The loud bark of our neighbour's Newfoundland resonated through the neighbourhood. Because of its sweet temperament, the Newfoundland is thought to be one of the best dogs for families with children.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Newfoundland was regarded as a local hero for helping to save a drowning man. Newfoundlands were originally bred to assist Canadian fishermen, which is likely why they are such strong swimmers.
